grammarPoints.pattern: A うが B うが
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the idea of 'no matter how... or', 'even if... or'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-volitional form + うが + Verb-volitional form + うが, or Adjective (-かろう) + が + Adjective (-かろう) + が
grammarPoints.example: 朝早かろうが夜遅かろうが、いつもバスが遅れる。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: No matter whether it's early morning or late at night, the bus is always late.

grammarPoints.pattern: A うと B うと
grammarPoints.meaning: Shows that the speaker is indifferent to both conditions; 'whether A or B'.
grammarPoints.usage: い-adjective (-かろう) + と, な-adjective / Noun + であろうと
grammarPoints.example: 雨が降ろうと晴れようと、私は毎日ジョギングをします。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Whether it's raining or sunny, I jog every day.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'while also', 'at the same time as'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + かたわら, Noun + のかたわら
grammarPoints.example: 彼は仕事をするかたわら、大学に通っている。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: While working, he also attends university.

grammarPoints.pattern: A かれ B かれ
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'whether A or B'; both situations are included.
grammarPoints.usage: Commonly i-adjective stems + かれ + i-adjective stems + かれ (e.g. 早かれ遅かれ). Also sometimes Noun + かれ + Noun + かれ in older usage.
grammarPoints.example: 冬かれ夏かれ、毎日ジョギングする。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Whether it's winter or summer, I jog every day.

grammarPoints.pattern: A だの B だの
grammarPoints.meaning: Used to list examples (often with a critical or complaining tone); 'things like A, B, etc.'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun/Verb casual + だの + Noun/Verb casual + だの
grammarPoints.example: 彼はいつも遅刻だの、仕事を忘れるだので困る。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I'm troubled because he's always late, forgets work, and so on.

grammarPoints.pattern: A であれ B であれ
grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates the same statement applies to both A and B; 'whether A or B'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun A + であれ + Noun B + であれ
grammarPoints.example: 雨であれ雪であれ、試合は中止にならない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Whether it's rain or snow, the match will not be canceled.

grammarPoints.pattern: A というか B というか
grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'rather than say A, it's more like B', or 'whether to call it A or B'.
grammarPoints.usage: Phrase A + というか + Phrase B + というか
grammarPoints.example: 彼は無礼というか、直接的というか、とにかくはっきりしている。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He's rather rude, or maybe just direct; in any case, he is very blunt.

grammarPoints.pattern: A とも B とも
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses two possibilities; 'either A or B', 'whether A or B'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + とも + Noun + とも (or sometimes Verb forms for each A, B)
grammarPoints.example: 決断とも誤りとも、結果は時間が教えてくれるでしょう。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Whether it's a wise decision or a mistake, time will show the result.

grammarPoints.pattern: A にしろ B にしろ
grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'whether it is A or B'; 'regardless of A or B'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun A + にしろ + Noun B + にしろ, or Verb-casual A + にしろ + Verb-casual B + にしろ
grammarPoints.example: 暑いにしろ寒いにしろ、毎日運動するべきです。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Whether it's hot or cold, you should exercise every day.

grammarPoints.pattern: A にせよ B にせよ
grammarPoints.meaning: Either A or B; Regardless of whether it's A or B.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + にせよ + Noun + にせよ (also works with verbs in dictionary form + にせよ)
grammarPoints.example: 雨にせよ雪にせよ、試合は中止しない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Whether it's rain or snow, the match won't be cancelled.

grammarPoints.pattern: A につけ B につけ
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'whether... or...', 'both... and...', 'in either case'.
grammarPoints.usage: Phrase A (dictionary/adjective form) + につけ、Phrase B (dictionary/adjective form) + につけ
grammarPoints.example: 彼には笑うにつけ泣くにつけ、とても魅力的だ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He is very charming whether he’s laughing or crying.

grammarPoints.pattern: A のやら B のやら
grammarPoints.meaning: Used when the speaker is unsure or confused between multiple possibilities.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun1 + のやら + Noun2 + のやら (also works with adjectives and verbs + のやら)
grammarPoints.example: 彼が怒っているのやら、悲しいのやら、私には分からない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I don't know whether he's angry or sad.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun1 が Noun1 なら、 Noun2 も Noun2 だ
grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates a parallel or matching situation; 'if Noun1 is (truly) Noun1, then Noun2 is also Noun2'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun1 + が + (repeat Noun1) + なら、Noun2 + も + (repeat Noun2) + だ
grammarPoints.example: 鬼が鬼なら、人間も人間だ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If demons are indeed demons, humans are likewise humans.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun1 も Noun1 なら、Noun2 も Noun2 だ
grammarPoints.meaning: Highlights two parallel facts or characteristics; 'if it’s said that ~, then it can also be said that ~'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun1 + も + (repeat Noun1) + なら、Noun2 + も + (repeat Noun2) + だ
grammarPoints.example: 君も君なら、私も私だ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If you are you, then I am also me.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'B cannot exist without A'; 'B only exists because of A'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun1 + あっての + Noun2
grammarPoints.example: 家族あっての私です。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I am who I am thanks to my family.

grammarPoints.meaning: Do one thing while also doing another; 'while', 'and at the same time'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + かたがた
grammarPoints.example: 東京へ出張のかたがた、友人に会いに行った。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: While on a business trip to Tokyo, I also went to see a friend.

grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'while...at the same time', 'on the occasion of', or 'along with'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + がてら
grammarPoints.example: 散歩がてらに、近くの公園で花を摘みました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: While taking a walk, I picked some flowers in the nearby park.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used with large numbers or measurements to emphasize 'at least that many' or 'no less than.'
grammarPoints.usage: Number + Counter + からある
grammarPoints.example: 彼のコレクションは500個からある。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He has at least 500 items in his collection.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to indicate that something is judged, estimated, or considered from a certain point or aspect.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + からする
grammarPoints.example: 彼の態度からすると、彼はその計画に反対しているようだ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Judging from his attitude, he seems to be against the plan.

grammarPoints.meaning: Defines the starting point or the origin; 'from'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + からの
grammarPoints.example: 日本からの手紙を受け取りました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I received a letter from Japan.

grammarPoints.meaning: Express the perspective of the noun; 'from ~'s point of view.'
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + から言わせれば
grammarPoints.example: 先生から言わせれば、毎日勉強するべきだ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: From the teacher's point of view, you should study every day.

grammarPoints.meaning: Describes 'entirely', 'all together', or 'as a whole group'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + ぐるみ
grammarPoints.example: 家族ぐるみで旅行に行きました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: We went on a trip with the whole family.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'though there is ... (some negative or burdensome aspect), still ...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + こそあれ + (result/continuation)
grammarPoints.example: 問題こそあれ、プロジェクトは順調に進んでいます。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Though there are problems, the project is progressing smoothly.

grammarPoints.meaning: Emphasizes that 'it is precisely Noun that ...', then adds a contrasting or additional point.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + こそ + (statement) + が + (contrasting/additional statement)
grammarPoints.example: お金こそ必要だが、それだけが人生のすべてではない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Money is indeed necessary, but it isn't everything in life.

grammarPoints.meaning: An emphatic pattern meaning 'it may be X, but definitely not Y.' Often pairs with a negative statement.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + こそすれ + (negative or contrasting statement)
grammarPoints.example: 感謝こそすれ、非難などできません。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I might feel grateful, but I could never criticize.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun ごとき / Noun ごとく
grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'like a...', 'as if...', expressing a simile or metaphor.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + ごとき, Noun + ごとく, Verb-casual + ごとく, い-Adjective + ごとく
grammarPoints.example: 彼は天使のごとく純粋だ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He is as pure as an angel.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expressing that something 'is not'; 'it's not like...'. Colloquial/masculine form of ではあるまいし.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun or Na-Adjective + じゃあるまいし
grammarPoints.example: 彼は子供じゃあるまいし、その問題をしっかりと解決するべきだ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He’s not a child, so he should solve that problem properly.

grammarPoints.meaning: Denotes 'entirely' or 'nothing but' the preceding noun.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + ずくめ
grammarPoints.example: 彼は最近、失敗ずくめだ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He has had nothing but failures recently.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun だけではすまない
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'it can't be settled with just...', 'cannot be resolved merely by...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + だけではすまない
grammarPoints.example: この問題は謝罪だけではすまない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: This problem cannot be settled with just an apology.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to show a strong negative: 'not even ~', 'not a single ~'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + たりとも + Negative Verb
grammarPoints.example: 一分たりとも無駄にするな。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Don’t waste even a single minute.

grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates 'being in the position/state of', used for roles or statuses.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun1 + たる + Noun2
grammarPoints.example: リーダーたる者は、常に先を見て行動すべきだ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: A person who is a leader should always look ahead and act accordingly.

grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'even', 'as much as', used for emphasis in formal contexts.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + ですら
grammarPoints.example: 明日試験があるのに、彼はテキストですら読まない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He doesn’t even read the textbook, despite having a test tomorrow.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun でなくてなんだろう
grammarPoints.meaning: A strong rhetorical question: 'If not X, then what is it?'
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + でなくてなんだろう
grammarPoints.example: これが真実でなくてなんだろう。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If this isn’t the truth, then what is?

grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'it’s not as if...', 'it’s not that...', more formal than じゃあるまいし.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + ではあるまいし
grammarPoints.example: 彼女はプロの歌手ではあるまいし、完璧を求めるのは酷だ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: She’s not a professional singer, so it’s rather harsh to demand perfection.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun と Noun を兼ねて
grammarPoints.meaning: Used to indicate doing two things at once or fulfilling two roles/purposes.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + と + Noun + を兼ねて
grammarPoints.example: お父さんは社長と経理部長を兼ねています。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: My father serves as both the company president and the head of accounting.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun といい Noun といい
grammarPoints.meaning: Used to express 'both A and B'; 'whether it's A or B'; 'not to mention A and also B'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun1 + といい + Noun2 + といい + Comment
grammarPoints.example: 日本の食べ物といい観光地といい、すべてが素晴らしいです。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Both Japanese food and tourist spots are all wonderful.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to specify or define one noun with another; 'the noun called', 'the noun that is', or 'a certain'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun1 という Noun2
grammarPoints.example: 宮崎駿という人は有名なアニメーション監督です。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The person called Hayao Miyazaki is a famous animation director.

grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'it's approximately...' or 'it's about...'. Used to show approximation or a general assessment.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + というところだ
grammarPoints.example: 今回の試験の合格者は半数というところだろう。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The passers in this exam would be approximately half.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to express a generic concept: 'all ~', 'any ~ of that kind'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + というもの
grammarPoints.example: 子供というものは、毎日たくさん遊びます。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Children, as a group, play a lot every day.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun といったところだ
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'at most', 'as much as', or 'limited to'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + といったところだ
grammarPoints.example: 彼の英語レベルは初級といったところだ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: His English level is at most beginner level.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun といわず Noun といわず
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'both A and B' or 'be it A or B'; applies to both without distinction.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun1 + といわず + Noun2 + といわず + (rest of the sentence)
grammarPoints.example: 冬といわず夏といわず、彼はいつもアイスクリームを食べます。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Be it winter or summer, he always eats ice cream.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses strong feelings about a topic; 'speaking of', 'when it comes to'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + ときたら
grammarPoints.example: 寿司ときたら、彼は何も食べられない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: When it comes to sushi, he can't eat anything.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun とは比べものにならない
grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates something is not comparable; 'beyond comparison'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + とは比べものにならない
grammarPoints.example: 新しい車の速さは古い車とは比べものにならない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The speed of the new car is not comparable to the old one.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to criticize or question unbecoming behavior by someone of a certain status.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + ともあろう + Noun
grammarPoints.example: 先生ともあろう者が、そんな間違いをするなんて。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: For a teacher, it's shocking to make such a mistake.

grammarPoints.meaning: 'When it comes to...', emphasizes a change of situation or status.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + ともなると
grammarPoints.example: クリスマスともなると、街中がきらきらと輝いて見えます。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: When it comes to Christmas time, the whole city sparkles.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'if it comes to', 'when', or 'once'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + ともなれば
grammarPoints.example: 試験ともなれば、大抵の人が緊張するものです。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: When it comes to exams, most people get nervous.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to express 'in combination with', 'together with', 'along with'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + と相まって
grammarPoints.example: 天気の良さと相まって、ピクニックは大成功でした。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: In combination with the good weather, the picnic was a great success.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'without ~, there can't be ~'; 'can't do ~ without first doing ~'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + なくして + Sentence ～はない
grammarPoints.example: 努力なくして成功はない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: There is no success without effort.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the necessity of something; 'cannot do without', 'not possible without'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + なしでは～ない
grammarPoints.example: 水なしでは生きられない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: We cannot live without water.

grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'without', 'cannot do without', 'not possible without'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + なしには + Verb-negative
grammarPoints.example: お金なしには生活ができない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I cannot get by without money.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'maybe X is possible, but Y is definitely not'. Often 'let alone...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun1 + ならいざ知らず + Noun2 (comment)
grammarPoints.example: 数学ならいざ知らず、物理なんて全然わからない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Math might be manageable, but as for physics, I'm completely clueless.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses something unique or characteristic only of that noun; 'only found in', 'only possible with'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + ならでは
grammarPoints.example: これは日本ならではの風景ですね。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: This is a landscape you can only find in Japan.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun なり Noun なり
grammarPoints.meaning: Lists alternatives of the same kind; 'either A or B', 'A or B, for example'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + なり + Noun + なり
grammarPoints.example: 映画なり、音楽なり、何か趣味はありますか。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Do you have any hobbies, such as movies or music?

grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates even a small amount or degree; 'at least', 'even a little'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + なりとも
grammarPoints.example: 時間が限られているので、一時間なりとも練習すべきだ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Since time is limited, you should practice for at least an hour.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun に Noun を重ねて
grammarPoints.meaning: This expression is used to describe repeated actions or states, 'one after another' or 'pile up'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun に Noun を重ねて
grammarPoints.example: 彼女は失敗に失敗を重ねて、とうとう会社を辞めた。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: She piled up failures upon failures and finally quit the company.

grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates a specific situation or environment in which something happens or is the case.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + にあっては
grammarPoints.example: 戦争時にあっては、すべての人々が困難に直面していました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: In wartime, all people were facing difficulties.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun にあるまじき Noun
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the idea of 'unfitting', 'unbecoming' or 'inappropriate'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun1 にあるまじき Noun2
grammarPoints.example: 彼は教師にあるまじき言動をとった。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He took actions that are unbecoming of a teacher.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the idea 'even for', 'even though', or 'in spite of'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + にして
grammarPoints.example: 彼は医者にしてその基本的な知識がないのが信じられない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I can't believe that even as a doctor, he doesn't have that basic knowledge.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'only when/after... for the first time'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + にして初めて
grammarPoints.example: 大人にして初めて、親の苦労が分かった。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Only when I became an adult did I understand my parents' struggles for the first time.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the concept of 'even'; 'even in', 'even as', 'even to'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + にすら
grammarPoints.example: 彼にすらその問題は解けなかった。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Even he could not solve that problem.

grammarPoints.meaning: This expresses the idea of 'not only...but also', 'not stopping at...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + にとどまらず + Noun + も
grammarPoints.example: このアプリは、日本語にとどまらず、他の言語もサポートしています。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: This app not only supports Japanese, but also other languages.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun にひきかえ Noun は
grammarPoints.meaning: Represents 'in contrast to', 'as opposed to'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun 1 + にひきかえ + Noun 2 + は
grammarPoints.example: 彼の親切さにひきかえ、彼女は無感情だ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: In contrast to his kindness, she is emotionless.

grammarPoints.meaning: This expresses 'Even more than; exceeding'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + にもまして
grammarPoints.example: 私は彼にもまして、音楽を愛しています。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I love music even more than he does.

grammarPoints.meaning: Regardless of, irrespective of.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + によらず
grammarPoints.example: 結果は勉強時間によらず変わらないでしょう。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The result will not change regardless of the study time.

grammarPoints.meaning: Meaning 'ahead of', 'before', or 'preceding in time'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + に先駆けて
grammarPoints.example: この映画は日本に先駆けて、アメリカで公開されました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: This film was released in America ahead of Japan.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the idea of 'in accordance with', 'based on'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun1 + に即した + Noun2
grammarPoints.example: 社会のニーズに即した教育改革が必要だ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: We need an educational reform that is in accordance with the needs of society.

grammarPoints.meaning: The grammar point Noun に即して Verb is used to mean 'to act in accordance with', 'in line with' or 'based on'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + に即して + Verb
grammarPoints.example: 会社のポリシーに即して行動しましょう。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Let's act in accordance with the company's policy.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'according to', 'if you ask', 'in the opinion of'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + に言わせれば
grammarPoints.example: 先生に言わせれば、毎日勉強することが重要だと言う。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: According to the teacher, it's important to study every day.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun に限ったことではない
grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates that something is not only limited to; 'not only', 'not just'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + に限ったことではない
grammarPoints.example: この問題は日本に限ったことではない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: This issue is not only limited to Japan.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun に限ったことでもない
grammarPoints.meaning: 'Not limited to'; 'not just', 'not exclusively'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + に限ったことでもない
grammarPoints.example: この試験が難しいのは、数学に限ったことでもない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The exam being difficult is not limited to just math.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the idea that 'nothing but', 'nothing is better than'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + に限る
grammarPoints.example: こういう時には家族に話すに限る。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: At times like this, there's nothing better than talking to your family.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the idea of 'taking something out from something else'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun1 + をぬいた + Noun2
grammarPoints.example: このサラダはにんじんをぬいたサラダです。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: This is a salad with the carrots removed.

grammarPoints.meaning: This is a way to express 'minus' or 'except for' some specific noun.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + ぬいて
grammarPoints.example: 私たちは、彼ぬいて全員が集まることができました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: We were able to gather everyone except for him.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the concept of doing something completely or thoroughly.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-stem + ぬく
grammarPoints.example: 彼は一日中本を読みぬく。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He will read the book all day long.

grammarPoints.meaning: Depends on; up to
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + のいかんだ/Noun + のいかんでは
grammarPoints.example: 彼が来るのいかんで決めよう。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Let's decide depending on whether he comes or not.

grammarPoints.meaning: It depends on the Noun
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + のいかんでは
grammarPoints.example: 試験の結果のいかんでは、大学の入学許可を得られるかどうかが決まります。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Whether you can get permission to enter university depends on the result of the exam.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun のいかんにかかわらず
grammarPoints.meaning: Regardless of, irrespective of.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + のいかんにかかわらず
grammarPoints.example: 結果のいかんにかかわらず、彼は決定を後悔しなかった。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Regardless of the outcome, he didn't regret his decision.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun のいかんによっては
grammarPoints.meaning: Depending on the matter; depending on noun
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + のいかんによっては
grammarPoints.example: 天気のいかんによっては、ピクニックを延期しましょう。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Depending on the weather, we should postpone the picnic.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun のいかんによらず
grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'regardless of', 'irrespective of', or 'no matter'
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + のいかんによらず
grammarPoints.example: 試験の結果のいかんによらず、自分を信じ続けてください。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Regardless of the test results, keep believing in yourself.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'like' or 'as if'; something/someone resembles something else strongly.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun1 + のごとき + Noun2
grammarPoints.example: 彼は神のごとき存在だ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He is an existence like a god.

grammarPoints.meaning: Because it is about ~, considering it's ~
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + のことだから
grammarPoints.example: 彼のことだから、きっと大丈夫だと思う。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Because it's him, I think it will certainly be fine.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun の 嫌いがある
grammarPoints.meaning: Have a dislike for a particular Noun
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + の嫌いがある
grammarPoints.example: 彼は魚の嫌いがあるので、寿司を食べません。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He has a dislike for fish, so he doesn't eat sushi.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the idea of 'Before doing something; on the verge of'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + の手前
grammarPoints.example: 試験の手前、遊びに行くのはやめた方がいい。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Just before the exam, it's better to stop going out to play.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to express the extreme or utmost point of something.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + の極み
grammarPoints.example: 彼の料理の極みは、誰もマネできない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The pinnacle of his cooking is something nobody can imitate.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'the height of', 'the extreme of' something.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + の至り
grammarPoints.example: 彼の冗談には驚きの至りだ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: His jokes are the height of surprise.

grammarPoints.meaning: ‘I can understand it for ~, but for …? (surprising)’
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + はいざ知らず, Noun + とは/なんて/しかし etc.
grammarPoints.example: 彼が遅れるのはいざ知らず、彼女まで遅刻するとは意外だ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Well, I can understand him being late, but even her...? That's surprising.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'not to mention ~, even ~'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun1 はおろか, Noun2 すら/さえ ～
grammarPoints.example: 彼は走るはおろか、速く歩くことすらできない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He can't even walk fast, let alone run.

grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'not just A, but even B'; 'let alone A, even B'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun1 + はおろか + Noun2 + まで
grammarPoints.example: 彼は英語はおろか、日本語までペラペラなんです。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He is not just fluent in English, but even in Japanese.

grammarPoints.meaning: 'Not only...but also', 'not to mention', 'to say nothing of'
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + はおろか + Noun + も
grammarPoints.example: 絵を描くことはおろか、字さえ書けない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Needless to say drawing pictures, he can’t even write letters.

grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'putting aside', 'aside from', 'notwithstanding'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + はさておき
grammarPoints.example: 試験の結果はさておき、この学期はとても学ぶことが多かった。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Aside from the exam results, I learned a lot this semester.

grammarPoints.meaning: This phrase means 'regardless of' or 'no matter how…'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + はどうであれ
grammarPoints.example: 天候はどうであれ、試合は行われます。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: No matter what the weather is, the match will be held.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses a state in which something is entirely covered or filled with something else.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + まみれ
grammarPoints.example: 彼は泥まみれになって帰ってきた。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He returned home covered in mud.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun もさることながら Noun も
grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'not only... but also'; the second noun is especially emphasized.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun1 + もさることながら + Noun2 + も
grammarPoints.example: 彼の歌唱力もさることながら、ダンスも素晴らしい。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Not only his singing ability but also his dancing is wonderful.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to express 'as well as', 'also', or 'at the same time'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + も兼ねて
grammarPoints.example: 散歩も兼ねて、公園に行きました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I went to the park, also for a walk.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to express that combined with something else, it caused a certain outcome.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + も相まって
grammarPoints.example: 気候も相まって、この地域は農業に適しています。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Combined with the climate, this area is suitable for agriculture.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun を おいて他に Verb ない
grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'apart from ~ there's nothing else,' implying the Noun is the best or most suitable choice.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + をおいて他に + Verb negative form
grammarPoints.example: この仕事を彼に任せる人をおいて他にいない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Apart from him, there's no one else to entrust this job to.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to indicate means, methods, or time; 'with', 'by means of', 'at'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + をもって
grammarPoints.example: 彼は誠実さをもって人々に信頼されています。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He is trusted by people with his honesty.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun をものともせずに
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the idea that 'despite something, action was carried out', translating to 'without being fazed by something'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + をものともせずに
grammarPoints.example: 彼女は怖さをものともせずに、暗闇の中へ進んで行った。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Despite her fear, she went ahead into the darkness.

grammarPoints.meaning: Despite; Notwithstanding; Regardless of
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + をよそに
grammarPoints.example: 経済危機をよそに、彼は高級な車を買った。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Despite the economic crisis, he bought a luxury car.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun を余儀なくされる
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the idea of being forced into a certain situation, 'to be compelled', 'to be obliged'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + を + 余儀なくされる
grammarPoints.example: 彼は経済的困難により、退学を余儀なくされた。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Due to financial difficulties, he was forced to drop out of school.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to express 'on the assumption of', 'based on'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + を前提として
grammarPoints.example: 成功を前提として、ビジネスプランを作成しました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: We made a business plan on the assumption of success.

grammarPoints.meaning: Assuming; presupposing; on the assumption of.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + を前提にして
grammarPoints.example: 好天を前提にして、明日のピクニックの計画を立てました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: We planned tomorrow's picnic assuming fine weather.

grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'as a turning point', 'since (time)', or 'from (time) on'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + を境に(して)
grammarPoints.example: 父の死を境にして、彼の性格が一変した。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: His personality changed completely since his father's death.

grammarPoints.meaning: To take the opportunity to; taking the occasion to; on the occasion of.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + を機にして
grammarPoints.example: 引っ越しを機にして、家具を新しくしました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I took the opportunity of moving to get new furniture.

grammarPoints.pattern: Noun を皮切りに / を皮切りにして
grammarPoints.meaning: Used to indicate the starting point of some series of events or actions; 'starting with', 'beginning with'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + を皮切りに / を皮切りにして
grammarPoints.example: 彼はその論文を皮切りにして複数の研究を開始した。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Starting with that thesis, he started multiple research projects.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to express 'Starting with', 'Beginning with'
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + を皮切りに (して)
grammarPoints.example: 彼はその日を皮切りにして毎日ジムに通い始めました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Starting from that day, he began to go to the gym every day.

grammarPoints.meaning: 'Cannot help but do', or 'inevitable'
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + を禁じ得ない
grammarPoints.example: この結果には驚きを禁じ得ない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I can't help but be surprised at this result.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the idea of 'through' or 'via'; going through some process or phase.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + を経て
grammarPoints.example: 彼は苦労を経て成功を手に入れた。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He achieved success through hardships.

grammarPoints.meaning: Based on; taking into account; in light of
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + を踏まえて
grammarPoints.example: 過去の結果を踏まえて、新たな計画を立てました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Based on previous results, we have made a new plan.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the idea of 'as of', 'with', or 'from', indicating the end of something or a point of change.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + を限りに
grammarPoints.example: 今年度を限りに、この大学での教授活動を終えるつもりです。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I intend to end my teaching activities at this university as of this academic year.

grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates 'like' or 'as' something or someone; 'equivalent to', 'around'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + 並み
grammarPoints.example: 彼はプロのボクサー並みの力を持っています。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He has power equivalent to a professional boxer.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses a condition or requirement for something to be established: 'on the assumption that', 'under the condition of'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + 前提で
grammarPoints.example: 説明できる英語力がある前提で、この仕事を引き受けてください。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Please take on this job on the assumption that you have enough English skills to explain.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'as long as', 'while this condition is true'.
grammarPoints.usage:
Verb-dictionary form + 限り(は)
Noun(である) + 限り(は)
grammarPoints.example: 私が生きている限りは、あなたを支えます。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: As long as I'm alive, I will support you.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses doing something while doing another; 'while', 'on the occasion of'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb (dictionary or -ます stem) + がてら
grammarPoints.example: 散歩がてらに郵便局へ行った。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I went to the post office while taking a walk.

grammarPoints.meaning: Often used in the pattern 'Xこそすれ、Y〜ない', meaning 'One might do X, but definitely not Y'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ますstem + こそすれ、(絶対に)～ない
grammarPoints.example: 彼は友達を助けこそすれ、自分を卑下することはありません。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He might help his friends, but he never belittles himself.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'being forced to do something' or 'being made to do something'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual (non-past) + させられる
grammarPoints.example: 彼に無理やり飲ませられた。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He forced me to drink against my will.

grammarPoints.meaning: 'Cannot but', 'have no choice but to', 'forced to'
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + ざるを得ない (する → せざるを得ない)
grammarPoints.example: この仕事が嫌ならもう辞めざるを得ない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If you hate this job, you have no choice but to quit.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expressing regret for not having done something; not being able to; missing the chance to do it.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ない form (remove ない) + ずじまい
grammarPoints.example: 日本へ来たのに、一度も富士山を見ずじまいで帰国してしまった。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I came to Japan but ended up going home without ever getting to see Mt. Fuji.

grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'Even without doing (X), (Y) can still happen'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-negative stem + ずとも
grammarPoints.example: 朝ごはんを食べずとも、働くことができます。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Even without eating breakfast, I can work.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'cannot help but...', 'will definitely...', or 'must do something'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ない form (remove ない) + ずにはおかない
grammarPoints.example: 彼が困っていると聞いたら、助けずにはおかない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If I hear he is in trouble, I cannot help but assist him.

grammarPoints.meaning: 'Cannot do without...', 'unavoidable', 'have to'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ない form (remove ない) + ずにはすまない
grammarPoints.example: この問題を解決しないと、社会全体が影響を受けるので、解決せずにはすまない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Since this issue will affect the entire society if not resolved, we cannot do without solving it.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses unlikelihood or that something does not seem likely to happen.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ますstem + そうにない
grammarPoints.example: 彼はそんなに早く走れそうにない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He doesn't seem likely to run that fast.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses negative potential; 'it doesn't seem like...', 'it's not likely...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ますstem + そうもない
grammarPoints.example: 今日中に仕事を終えそうもない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It doesn't seem like I'll finish my work today.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses that as soon as one action finishes, another begins immediately.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ますstem + そばから
grammarPoints.example: 掃除をするそばから子供たちが散らかす。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: As soon as I clean, the kids mess it up.

grammarPoints.meaning: Emphasizes 'once something happens, there is no going back'; 'once', 'as soon as', etc.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual, past (た form) + が最後
grammarPoints.example: 彼が一度怒ったが最後、誰も彼を止めることはできません。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Once he gets angry, no one can stop him.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verb たことにしてください
grammarPoints.meaning: Asking someone to pretend or accept that something has already happened or taken a certain state.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb (past, casual) + ことにしてください
grammarPoints.example: 昨日のことは忘れたことにしてください。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Please act as if you have forgotten about yesterday.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verb たら Verb たで
grammarPoints.meaning: Conveys that if something happens (or doesn’t happen), there is a particular consequence or situation either way.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-た form + ら + (same Verb-た form) + で
grammarPoints.example: 行ったら行ったで大変だし、行かなかったら行かなかったで後悔しそうだ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If I go, it’s a hassle; if I don’t go, I’ll regret it.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verb たら きりがない
grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates an endless or unending cycle once an action is started; 'if one starts doing something, it will not stop.'
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-た form + ら + きりがない
grammarPoints.example: このエンジンを修理したら、またすぐ壊れて、直したらきりがない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If I fix this engine, it breaks again, and if I fix it again, it never ends.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses that once a certain action happens, the situation changes irreversibly—usually in a negative way.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-た form + ら最後
grammarPoints.example: このゲームを始めたら最後、時間の経つのを忘れてしまいます。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Once you start this game, you completely lose track of time.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses two alternating actions happening repeatedly.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ますstem + つ + Verb-ますstem + つ
grammarPoints.example: 朝から晩まで働きつ勉強しつで、疲れてしまった。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I’ve been working and studying from morning till night, and now I’m exhausted.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verb てからというもの
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses that ever since a certain event happened, a condition has continued until now.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-て form + からというもの
grammarPoints.example: 彼女と別れてからというもの、一人で過ごす時間が増えました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Ever since I broke up with her, I've spent more time alone.

grammarPoints.meaning: Emphasizes 'only by doing something, a certain result or realization can occur.'
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-て form + こそ
grammarPoints.example: 実際に使ってこそ、その価値を理解できる。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: You can only understand its value by actually using it.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses a repeated pattern or cycle, often implying a frustrating outcome; 'whenever X happens, Y happens again.'
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-て form + は
grammarPoints.example: 彼女に会っては、いつも緊張してしまいます。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Whenever I meet her, I get nervous.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses a repeated pattern of action; translates as 'every time', 'whenever', etc.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-て form + は + Verb
grammarPoints.example: 私が通勤しては、電子書籍を読んでいます。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Whenever I commute, I read e-books.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'even if it means doing...', 'no matter what it takes'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-て form + までも
grammarPoints.example: 試験に合格するために、寝る時間を削ってまでも勉強します。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I will study to pass the exam, even if it means cutting down on sleep.

grammarPoints.meaning: 'Show by doing', 'demonstrate', 'prove by action'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-て form + みせる
grammarPoints.example: 彼はそのパズルを解いてみせた。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He solved the puzzle to show me.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used with certain emotional/mental verbs to show a strong, unceasing emotion: 'can't stop', 'never cease to'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-て form + やまない (common with certain verbs)
grammarPoints.example: 私は母を思ってやまない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I can't stop thinking of my mother.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verb ないではおかない
grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'cannot help but do', 'will definitely do', or 'is bound to happen'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ない form + ではおかない
grammarPoints.example: 彼女は毎回遅刻をしては、先生に怒られないではおかない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Every time she's late, she inevitably gets scolded by the teacher.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verb ないではすまない
grammarPoints.meaning: 'Cannot end without doing', 'must do'—an unavoidable moral or social necessity.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ない form + ではすまない
grammarPoints.example: 失敗をしたら、謝らないではすまない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If you make a mistake, you have to apologize—there’s no way around it.

grammarPoints.meaning: 'Even if not to the extent of...', 'although not completely...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ない form + までも
grammarPoints.example: 全てを理解しないまでも、基本的なことは分かってほしい。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Even if you don't understand everything, I'd like you at least to grasp the basics.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verb ないものだろうか
grammarPoints.meaning: Expressing hope or wonder if something can be done: 'Isn't there a way...?', 'Can't we...?'
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-negative (often negative potential) + ものだろうか
grammarPoints.example: もっと時間があれば、ここに来られないものだろうか。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If I had more time, wouldn't it be possible to come here?

grammarPoints.pattern: Verb ないものでもない
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the idea that it's not entirely impossible or non-existent: 'It's not that I don't...', 'It's not that there aren't...'
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-negative form (ない form) + ものでもない
grammarPoints.example: 旅行に行きたいと思わないものでもない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It's not that I never want to travel.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to modify a noun with a negative verb form; 'a Noun without (Verb)'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb in negative form + の + Noun
grammarPoints.example: 笑いのない人生は、つまらない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: A life without laughter is boring.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verb ば きりがない
grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates there's no end once you start listing, doing, or saying something: 'If one starts to..., there will be no end.'
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-conditional form (ば) + きりがない
grammarPoints.example: 悪口を言い始めればきりがない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Once I start speaking ill of someone, there's no end.

grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'without even doing'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb (masu stem) + もしないで
grammarPoints.example: 調べもしないで、答えを書きました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I wrote the answer without even investigating.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses a strong denial or refusal: 'I would never...', 'No way I would...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb (masu stem) + やしない
grammarPoints.example: こんな時に泣きやしない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I would never cry at a time like this.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'the way/manner of doing something' or 'in order to / so that / try to'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb (dictionary or negative form) + ように (する / etc.)
grammarPoints.example: この問題を解くように努力します。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I will try to solve this problem.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verb ようか Verbるまいか
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses indecision: 'Should I do it or not?'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-volitional form + か + Verb-volitional negative form (まい) + か
grammarPoints.example: 彼に話そうか話すまいか、本当に迷っている。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I'm really unsure whether to talk to him or not.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verb ようが Verb るまいが
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'whether or not', 'no matter if something happens or not'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-volitional form + が + Verb-negative volitional form + が
grammarPoints.example: 彼が来ようが来るまいが、パーティーは始まります。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Whether he comes or not, the party will start.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'no way to do something,' 'impossible to do'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb (masu stem) + ようがない
grammarPoints.example: 電車が混んでいて、動きようがない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The train is so crowded that I can't move.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verb ようと Verbる まいと
grammarPoints.meaning: This structure indicates that regardless of whether one does (verb) or not, the outcome/attitude remains unchanged.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-volitional + と + Verb-negative volitional (～まい) + と
grammarPoints.example: あなたが来ようと来るまいと、パーティーは予定通りに始まります。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Whether you come or not, the party will start as scheduled.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to express 'even though one wants to do something, one can't for some reason'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-volitional form + にも + (reason/potential negative, etc.)
grammarPoints.example: もう少し速く走ろうにも、足が痛くて無理だ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I'd like to run a bit faster, but I can’t because my leg hurts.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verb ようにも Verb れない
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the inability to do something even if one wants/tries.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-volitional form + にも + (potential negative form / reason)
grammarPoints.example: 彼を信じようにも信じられない証拠がある。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Even if I want to believe him, there's evidence that prevents me from doing so.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'it's impossible to do something'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ます stem + ようもない
grammarPoints.example: この問題は解きようもない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It's impossible to solve this problem.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'letting something happen as it is'; 'just as something does'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + がままに
grammarPoints.example: 窓を開けるがままにしておいたら、風が部屋に入ってきました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I left the window open as it was, and the wind came into the room.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'as soon as...' or 'the moment when...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + が早いか
grammarPoints.example: 部屋に入るが早いか、彼はテレビをつけた。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: No sooner had he entered the room than he turned on the TV.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses preference to avoid something: 'rather than...', 'if it comes to doing X, I'd rather...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + くらいなら
grammarPoints.example: 一人で行くくらいなら、家にいるほうがましです。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I'd rather stay at home than go alone.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verbる こと なし に
grammarPoints.meaning: Used to express 'without doing something'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + ことなしに
grammarPoints.example: 試験を勉強することなしに、合格しました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I passed the exam without studying.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verbる ことのないように
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the desire or effort to prevent something: 'so as not to...', 'to avoid...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + ことのないように
grammarPoints.example: 車をなくすことのないように、駐車場で必ずロックしましょう。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Lock your car in the parking lot so you don't lose it.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to indicate that something can go on endlessly or without limits.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual + と + きりがない
grammarPoints.example: 彼の悪口を言うときりがない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If we start talking about his faults, there's no end.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to express 'without a particular intention', 'unconsciously', or 'before one knows it'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + ともなく + Verb
grammarPoints.example: 遠くを見るともなく窓の外を眺めた。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I found myself gazing out the window, not really looking at anything in particular.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verbる ともなしに Verb
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses doing something unintentionally or without conscious thought.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + ともなしに + Verb
grammarPoints.example: 本を読むともなしに眠ってしまった。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I ended up falling asleep while reading the book without really meaning to.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'as soon as' or 'the moment'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + なり
grammarPoints.example: 家に帰るなり、すぐに寝た。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: As soon as I got home, I went to sleep.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verbる にとどまらず～も
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'not only… but also', 'not limited to…'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun / Verb-dictionary form + にとどまらず + も/ほかのこと
grammarPoints.example: 彼は仕事にとどまらず、ボランティア活動もしている。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He does not just work; he also does volunteer activities.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verbる にはあたらない
grammarPoints.meaning: Used to say 'there is no need to...', 'it’s not necessary to...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + にはあたらない
grammarPoints.example: パニックに陥るにはあたらない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: There’s no need to panic.

grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates that doing the verb is impossible or difficult, even if one wants to.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + にも + (reason it can't be done)
grammarPoints.example: 明日雨が降ったとしても、傘を持つにも荷物が多すぎる。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Even if it rains tomorrow, I have too much luggage to bring an umbrella.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verbる にも Verb れない
grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses: 'Even if I try/want to do something, I cannot.'
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-volitional + にも + Verb-potential negative
grammarPoints.example: 彼を理解しようにも理解できない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Even if I try to understand him, I can't.

grammarPoints.pattern: Verbる べからざる Noun
grammarPoints.meaning: Used to express what should not be done; 'must not', 'should not'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + べからざる + Noun
grammarPoints.example: 人を裏切るべからざる行為だ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Betraying others is an act that must not be done.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the idea of 'must not do' or 'should not do'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ru + べからず
grammarPoints.example: 嘘をつくべからず。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: One must not tell lies.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the meaning of 'in order to', 'for the purpose of'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + べく
grammarPoints.example: 成功するべく、日々努力しています。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: In order to succeed, I am working hard every day.

grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'it's impossible to...' or 'there's no way to...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + べくもない
grammarPoints.example: その問題はとても難しく、解くべくもない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: That problem is so difficult that it's impossible to solve.

grammarPoints.meaning: It's not necessary to the extent of; no need to.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-る + までもない
grammarPoints.example: そんなに心配するまでもない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: There's no need to worry that much.

grammarPoints.meaning: Assuming or deciding something as...
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + ものとする
grammarPoints.example: ここでの話し合いは秘密とするものとします。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The discussions here are to be kept confidential.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the idea of 'as soon as', 'the moment...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + や否や
grammarPoints.example: 彼女が家に帰るや否や、すぐにテレビをつけました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: As soon as she returned home, she turned on the TV.

grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates a (often unfortunate) result or conclusion of an action.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + 始末だ
grammarPoints.example: 忘れてしまって、パスポートを家に置いてくる始末だった。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I ended up leaving my passport at home because I forgot.

grammarPoints.meaning: Tendency to do a negative action; have a bad habit of ~.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + 嫌いがある
grammarPoints.example: 彼女は遅刻する嫌いがある。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: She has a tendency to be late.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses uncertainty regarding duration; 'don't know when... will end'.
grammarPoints.usage: いつまで + Verb (dictionary form) + のやら
grammarPoints.example: この試験勉強はいつまで続くのやら。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I don't know when this exam study will end.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses potential or ability to do something; 'can', 'able to'.
grammarPoints.usage:
❶ (Group 1) Verb:  書く → 書ける / 飲む → 飲める, etc.
❷ (Group 2) Verb-ます stem + られる (食べる→食べられる、見る→見られる)
grammarPoints.example: 彼がこの問題を解けると思いますか？
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Do you think he can solve this problem?

grammarPoints.meaning: Expressing unexpected outcomes; 'just when I thought...', 'but...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Sentence + かと思いきや (Verb plain form, i-/na-Adjective, or Noun + だ + かと思いきや)
grammarPoints.example: 明日は晴れるかと思いきや、まさかの雨が降った。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I thought it would be sunny tomorrow, but unexpectedly it rained.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the reason or cause; 'because', 'due to', 'as a result of'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun / Verb / Adjective + がゆえに
grammarPoints.example: 愛情がゆえに、彼は彼女を許した。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Because of love, he forgave her.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the reason or cause for something; 'because of', 'due to'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun / Verb-dictionary form + がゆえの + Noun
grammarPoints.example: 愛がゆえの悲しみ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Sadness due to love.

grammarPoints.pattern: ～から Noun に 至る まで
grammarPoints.meaning: Expressing range from one thing to another; 'from...to', 'ranging from...to'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun (start) + から + Noun (end) + に至るまで
grammarPoints.example: このバンドの曲は、青年から老人に至るまで、人々に愛されています。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The songs of this band are loved by people ranging from the young to the elderly.

grammarPoints.meaning: To seem like; as if; as though.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-て + ごとく / Noun + の + ごとく
grammarPoints.example: 彼は鳥のごとく飛んでいるように見えた。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He looked as though he was flying like a bird.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to express the reason or premise for a decision or judgment; 'since', 'because'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb (plain form) + こととて / Noun + の + こととて / (な-Adjective + な) + こととて
grammarPoints.example: 彼は裁判に勝つために全資産を使うこととて、弁護士に頼んだ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Since he's using all his assets to win the trial, he hired a lawyer.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the idea of 'was able to do without'; 'managed to avoid'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ず form + に + すんだ
grammarPoints.example: 彼は事故を起こさずにすんだ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He managed to avoid having an accident.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'regardless of whether it is or isn't'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun / i-Adjective / na-Adjective / Verb + だろうとなかろうと
grammarPoints.example: 試験が難しいだろうとなかろうと、全力で頑張ります。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Regardless of whether the exam is difficult or not, I will do my best.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the speaker's intention or plan.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + つもりだ
grammarPoints.example: 明日は早く起きるつもりです。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I plan to wake up early tomorrow.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the speaker's intention or plan; 'with the intention of', 'planning to'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + つもりで
grammarPoints.example: 私は日本に住むつもりで日本語を勉強しています。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I am studying Japanese with the intention of living in Japan.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses that just doing something is not enough or will not suffice.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + ではすまない / い-Adjective + ではすまない / な-Adjective + ではすまない / Noun + ではすまない
grammarPoints.example: ただ謝るではすまない。何か行動を取らなければならない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Just apologizing will not suffice. Some action needs to be taken.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses a special situation or event due to certain circumstances.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + とあって / (Sometimes Verb + とあって, depending on context)
grammarPoints.example: 春休みとあって、公園は子供たちでいっぱいだ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Because it's spring break, the park is full of children.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses a condition; 'if', 'when', 'since'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual + とあれば / い-Adjective + とあれば / な-Adjective + だとあれば / Noun + だとあれば
grammarPoints.example: 無料とあれば、誰でも利用したいと思います。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If it's free, anyone would want to use it.

grammarPoints.meaning: Even if it is said that; Even though; Although.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + といえども / Verb-plain form + といえども / Adjective + といえども
grammarPoints.example: 彼が天才といえども、ミスをすることはあります。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Even though he’s a genius, he still makes mistakes.

grammarPoints.meaning: Express extreme exclamation; 'extremely', 'unbelievable', 'unsurpassed'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + といったらありはしない / な-Adjective + といったらありはしない
grammarPoints.example: 彼の英語の上手さといったらありはしない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: His English is unbelievably good.

grammarPoints.meaning: Emphasizes that something is to the extreme; 'you have no idea how...', 'it's incredibly...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual + といったらありゃしない / い-Adjective + といったらありゃしない / な-Adjective + だ + といったらありゃしない / Noun + だ + といったらありゃしない
grammarPoints.example: その店のラーメンは美味しいといったらありゃしない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: You have no idea how delicious the ramen at that shop is.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the extreme of something; 'nothing can be more ... than this'.
grammarPoints.usage: い-Adjective + といったらない / な-Adjective + だといったらない / Noun + だといったらない
grammarPoints.example: 今日は寒いといったらない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It’s extremely cold today.

grammarPoints.meaning: Highlights a situation or condition that is serious/extreme, often with a negative nuance.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual / い-Adjective / な-Adjective（＋だ） / Noun（＋だ） + ときている
grammarPoints.example: 仕事が忙しいときているので、なかなか休みが取れません。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Because work is so busy, I just can’t take any time off.

grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates a contrasting or inconvenient timing; 'just when...', 'even though...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ている + ところを / Noun + の + ところを / い-Adjective + ところを / な-Adjective + な + ところを
grammarPoints.example: ちょうど映画を見ているところを、停電で真っ暗になった。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Just when I was in the middle of watching a movie, the power went out and everything went dark.

grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates a general belief or widely accepted view; 'is considered', 'is seen as', 'is said to be'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual + とされる / い-Adjective + とされる / な-Adjective + だとされる / Noun + だとされる
grammarPoints.example: サッカーは世界で最も人気のあるスポーツとされています。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Soccer is considered the most popular sport in the world.

grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'even if' or 'even assuming'; emphasizes that the outcome won’t change.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual + としたところで / い-Adjective + としたところで / な-Adjective + だとしたところで / Noun + だとしたところで
grammarPoints.example: 彼が来るとしたところで、何も変わらないだろう。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Even if he comes, nothing will probably change.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'if', 'when', or 'assuming that' in a speculative sense.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual + とすると / い-Adjective + とすると / な-Adjective + だとすると / Noun + だとすると
grammarPoints.example: 彼が来るとすると、もうすぐ到着するはずです。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If he’s coming, he should arrive soon.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to express 'if it were the case that...', 'if we assume that...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual + とすれば / い-Adjective + とすれば / な-Adjective + だとすれば / Noun + だとすれば
grammarPoints.example: 彼が嘘つきだとすれば、その話は信じられない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If he’s a liar, then his story can’t be believed.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to express 'if it comes to...', 'when it becomes the case that...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual + となったら / Noun + となったら
grammarPoints.example: 旅行に行くとなったら、荷造りをしなければいけません。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If it comes to going on a trip, we have to pack.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to highlight a certain circumstance; 'when it comes to...', 'if it becomes...', 'in the event that...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual + となると / い-Adjective + となると / な-Adjective + だとなると / Noun + だとなると
grammarPoints.example: 試験となると、多くの学生が緊張する。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: When it comes to exams, many students get nervous.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the idea of 'if it comes to...; when we talk about...; in the case of...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual + となれば, い-Adjective + となれば, な-Adjective + だとなれば, Noun + だとなれば
grammarPoints.example: 彼がリーダーとなれば、プロジェクトは成功するでしょう。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If he becomes the leader, the project will probably succeed.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses something that the speaker heard; 'I've heard that', 'I was told that'.
grammarPoints.usage: Simplified phrase + とのことだ
grammarPoints.example: 週末にパーティーがあるとのことだ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I've heard that there is a party this weekend.

grammarPoints.meaning: Even though; although; but
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + とはいえ, な-Adjective + だとはいえ, い-Adjective + とはいえ, Verb-casual + とはいえ
grammarPoints.example: 彼は頭が良いとはいえ、少し怠け者だ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Although he is smart, he is a bit lazy.

grammarPoints.meaning: It seems that; apparently
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual + とみえて, い-Adjective + とみえて, な-Adjective + だとみえて, Noun + だとみえて
grammarPoints.example: 彼は運動が得意とみえて、毎日ジムに行っています。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He seems to be good at exercise, as he goes to the gym every day.

grammarPoints.meaning: It is considered that; It is thought that; It is believed that
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual + とみられる, Noun + とみられる
grammarPoints.example: 彼の行動は無責任とみられる。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: His behavior is considered irresponsible.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the concept of 'when one sees it as', 'viewed as', or 'considering'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual + とみると, い-Adjective + とみると, な-Adjective + だとみると, Noun + だとみると
grammarPoints.example: この問題を数学の視点でとみると、解決策が見えてきます。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: When one sees this problem from a mathematical perspective, a solution begins to emerge.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'no matter how much...', 'even if...'.
grammarPoints.usage: どんなに + Verb-volitional + うが, どんなに + い-Adjective(～かろう) + が, どんなに + な-Adjective + だろうが
grammarPoints.example: どんなに頑張ろうが、彼の速さには追いつけない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: No matter how hard I try, I can't catch up with his speed.

grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates an action or behavior that strongly implies a certain unspoken message or feeling.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-volitional + と言わんばかりに, い-Adjective + と言わんばかりに, な-Adjective + だと言わんばかりに, Noun + だと言わんばかりに
grammarPoints.example: 彼女は優勝したと言わんばかりに笑った。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: She laughed as if to say she won.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the concept of 'as if to say'; 'almost says'; 'suggests'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-plain form + と言わんばかりの Noun
grammarPoints.example: 田中さんは嬉しくて飛び上がると言わんばかりの笑顔を見せた。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Tanaka showed a smile as if to say he was so happy he could jump for joy.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses a state or condition continuing just as it is (e.g. 'from birth', 'while crying', 'in the old way').
grammarPoints.usage: Common set phrases: 生まれながらに, 涙ながらに, 昔ながらに, 子供ながらに, etc.
grammarPoints.example: 彼女は生まれながらにして優れた音感を持っている。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: She has had an excellent sense of pitch from birth.

grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates one action or state happening at the same time as the noun in question (e.g. 'dinner while watching TV').
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ますstem (or plain minus る) + ながら + の + Noun
grammarPoints.example: テレビを見ながらの夕食は、子供たちにとって楽しいだろう。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Eating dinner while watching TV might be fun for the children.

grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'even though' or 'despite'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb stem + ながらも, い-Adjective + ながらも, な-Adjective/Noun + ながらも
grammarPoints.example: 彼は貧しいながらも、幸せな生活を送っている。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Despite being poor, he leads a happy life.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the idea 'it's not that it's impossible' or 'it's not that I can't'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ないform + なくはない, い-Adjective－い + くはない, な-Adjective + ではなくはない, Noun + ではなくはない
grammarPoints.example: それを終えるのは難しくなくはない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It's not that it's impossible to finish it.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'not impossible' or 'might as well'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ないform + なくもない, い-Adjective－い + くもない, な-Adjective + でもない, Noun + でもない
grammarPoints.example: 彼がもうすぐ戻るなら、待つなくもない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If he’s coming back soon, waiting wouldn’t be a bad idea.

grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'if it is X, then it's X in its own way', emphasizing unique qualities.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun/Adjective + なら + (same Noun/Adjective) + なりに
grammarPoints.example: 彼はまだ初心者なら初心者なりに頑張っている。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Since he’s still a beginner, he’s doing his best in his own beginner way.

grammarPoints.meaning: Means 'no need to go that far' or 'not necessary'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + には及ばない
grammarPoints.example: ファーストクラスに乗るには及ばない、エコノミーでも十分だ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: There’s no need to go as far as flying first class; economy is enough.

grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates something is unbearable or not worth doing (e.g., 'unbearable to watch', 'unbearable to listen to').
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + に堪えない, Noun + に堪えない
grammarPoints.example: 彼の冗談は聞くに堪えない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: His jokes are unbearable to listen to.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to say that something is 'worth doing' or 'can stand up to' something (the positive counterpart of ～に堪えない).
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + に堪える, Noun + に堪える
grammarPoints.example: 彼の歌声は聞くに堪える。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: His singing voice is worth listening to.

grammarPoints.meaning: To endure or withstand something; 'endure', 'withstand', 'tolerate'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + に耐える
grammarPoints.example: 彼は厳しい修行に耐えた。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He endured the harsh training.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the outcome or final conclusion of a process; 'reached the point', 'led to'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-てform + に至った or Noun / Verb-dictionary + に至る (more general).
grammarPoints.example: 彼は練習を重ねて、ついにプロのギタリストに至った。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: After repeated practice, he finally became a professional guitarist.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses that something is the best or most desirable course of action; 'nothing better than...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb (dictionary form) + に越したことはない, い-Adjective + に越したことはない, な-Adjective/Noun + である + に越したことはない
grammarPoints.example: 早く準備するに越したことはない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It's best to prepare early.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses 'not difficult to ~' in a formal/literary sense; e.g., 'not hard to imagine/understand'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + に難くない (commonly with 想像する, 理解する, 察する, etc.)
grammarPoints.example: 彼の喜びは想像に難くない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It's not hard to imagine his delight.

grammarPoints.pattern: ～のは Noun ぐらいのものだ
grammarPoints.meaning: Conveys that 'only (Noun) is the case' or 'nothing but (Noun)'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual + のは + Noun + ぐらいのものだ, い-Adjective + のは + Noun + ぐらいのものだ, etc.
grammarPoints.example: この小説を読むのは暇つぶしぐらいのものだ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Reading this novel is nothing but a way to kill time.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses regret or a missed opportunity: 'if only', 'had I but...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-ば + Verb-past + ものを, い-Adjective + ければ + ものを, な-Adjective/Noun + であれば + ものを, etc.
grammarPoints.example: 早く起きれば、遅刻しなかったものを。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If only I'd woken up early, I wouldn't have been late.

grammarPoints.meaning: A suffix meaning “looking or seeming like ~” (often appears with nouns/adjectives).
grammarPoints.usage: [Noun/Adjective stem] + びた (forms a 連体形 modifier, e.g., 大人びた人 “an adult-like person”)
grammarPoints.example: 大人びた考え方をする子供
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: A child who thinks in a very grown-up way

grammarPoints.meaning: A suffix meaning “to appear/to become ~,” often used with certain adjectives or nouns.
grammarPoints.usage: Adjective/Noun + びる (to form a verb)
grammarPoints.example: 彼女は年齢より大人びている。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: She seems older than her actual age.

grammarPoints.meaning: Often appears as a past form of ～ぶる, meaning 'acted/pretended like ~' (or literally 'hit/bashed', depending on context).
grammarPoints.usage: Noun/Adjective + ぶる → ぶった (past tense), e.g., 偉そうぶった, 大人ぶった
grammarPoints.example: 彼は何でも知っているかのようにぶった態度を取る。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He takes on an attitude as though he knows everything.

grammarPoints.meaning: Te-form of ～ぶる, meaning 'acting/pretending to be ~'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun/Adjective + ぶる → ぶって (te-form)
grammarPoints.example: 彼は何でも知ったかぶって話をする。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He talks as if he knows everything.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses the amount of time elapsed since doing something last.
grammarPoints.usage: Time expression + ぶり
grammarPoints.example: 三年ぶりに彼に会いました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I met him for the first time in three years.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used when someone is acting or pretending to be something they are not (often a negative connotation).
grammarPoints.usage: Noun / (Adjective stem) + ぶる
grammarPoints.example: 彼はあたかも知っているかのように学者ぶる。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He acts like a scholar, as if he knows everything.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses a limit or extent; 'it's only up to...', 'no more than...'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb (dictionary/ない form) + までだ, い-Adjective + までだ, Noun + までだ
grammarPoints.example: 彼とは友達までだ。それ以上の関係ではありません。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: With him, it's only friendship—nothing more.

grammarPoints.meaning: Used to dismiss or negate something’s importance; 'it’s nothing at all', 'it doesn’t matter'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + もなんでもない, い-Adjective + もなんでもない, な-Adjective + なもなんでもない, Noun + もなんでもない
grammarPoints.example: 100万円を負けるもなんでもない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Losing a million yen is no big deal at all.

grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates an assumption or supposition; 'assuming', 'under the assumption that'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-casual + ものとして, い-Adjective + ものとして, な-Adjective + なものとして, Noun + のものとして
grammarPoints.example: 雨が降るものとして、傘を持って行きました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Assuming it would rain, I took an umbrella.

grammarPoints.meaning: Emphasizes the reason or purpose for an action; 'in order to', 'for the sake of'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-negative stem + んがために
grammarPoints.example: 健康を保たんがために、毎日運動をしています。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I exercise daily in order to maintain my health.

grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates 'as though about to ~' or 'as if to say ~'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-negative stem + ん + ばかりに
grammarPoints.example: 彼は何も知らんばかりに、私の質問を無視した。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He ignored my question as if he didn’t know anything.

grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates no problem or obstacle; 'it’s fine if...', 'there’s no issue'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-て form + も差し支えない, Noun + が差し支えない
grammarPoints.example: 多少遅くても差し支えないです。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It’s no problem if you’re a bit late.

grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates the time or occasion when something happens; 'when', 'at the time of'.
grammarPoints.usage: Verb-dictionary form + 折に, Verb-た形 + 折に, Noun + の折に
grammarPoints.example: 父が病気の折に、私は留学していました。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: When my father was ill, I was studying abroad.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses an extreme state, often negative; 'utterly', 'extremely', 'boundlessly'.
grammarPoints.usage: な-Adjective（語幹）+ 極まりない, い-Adjective（連用形）+ こと + 極まりない, Noun + の極まりない
grammarPoints.example: 彼の失礼な態度は極まりない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: His rude attitude is utterly beyond words.

grammarPoints.meaning: Also expresses an extreme degree or state, typically negative.
grammarPoints.usage: な-Adjective（語幹）+ 極まる, い-Adjective（連用形）+ こと + 極まる, etc.
grammarPoints.example: 彼の言動は失礼極まる。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: His words and actions are extremely rude.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses insufficiency or lack; 'not enough', 'insufficient'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun + (が) 足りない, Verb-casual + ほど/だけ + (が) 足りない
grammarPoints.example: 私の日本語の能力はまだまだ足りない。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: My Japanese skills are still not enough.

grammarPoints.meaning: Indicates that something is worthy or sufficient to be called/used as ~; 'worthy of', 'enough to ~'.
grammarPoints.usage: Noun/Verb-dictionary form + に足る + Noun
grammarPoints.example: 彼は信頼に足る人物だ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He is a person worthy of trust.

grammarPoints.meaning: Expresses an extreme degree of emotion or reaction; 'I feel so ~', 'as ~ as can be'.
grammarPoints.usage: い-Adjective + 限りだ, な-Adjective + な/である + 限りだ, Noun + の + 限りだ
grammarPoints.example: 彼女が急に辞めてしまった。驚きの限りだ。
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: She suddenly quit. I'm as shocked as can be.
